title: You scanned a network with NMap and you found bunch of open ports. What's next? What tools do you use to take advantage of these ports? - Quora

response.answer_text: You're still in the reconnaissance phase. At this point, you do a more targeted scan to fingerprint the server os, applications on the ports, patch levels, etc. Once you're done fingerprinting, then you look for known bugs on those versions. At this point you make your report to the client, unless your contract specifically includes more intrusive testing.
